title: Faster approvals, subsidised spaces can boost startups in Delhi: CII Delhi chairman Rikant Pittie
La Niña likely by year-end, may bring colder winter in India: Experts
description: Meteorologists are warning of a potential La Niña return later this year, which could significantly impact global weather patterns. For India, this cooling phase in the Pacific is often associated with colder-than-normal winters. Models indicate a high probability of La Niña developing between October and December, potentially leading to harsher winters and increased snowfall, particularly in northern regions.

title: Manoj Bajpayee’s Jugnuma The Fable is a hypnotic plunge into a world where magical realism is both mirror and myth
Venezuela says US navy raided a tuna boat in Caribbean as tensions rise
Owaisi hits BJP over India-Pak match, cites Pahalgam; asks if money matters more than 26 lives?
description: Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly criticized the BJP, questioning the decision to allow India's Asia Cup cricket match against Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack, where 26 tourists were killed. He questioned if the revenue from the match outweighed the loss of lives, highlighting the inconsistency with the government's stance on terrorism.

title: She knew him for a decade. He was her closest friend — until he betrayed her in a brutal attack
‘Doppelganger did it’: Group chat shows suspect’s demeanor after Kirk killing
description: Following the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Tyler Robinson initially joked about his resemblance to the suspect in an online group chat. He quipped about a "doppelganger" trying to implicate him, even as the FBI sought the public's help in identifying the individual captured in surveillance images.

title: Andhra Pradesh HC directs govt. to extend tenure of APSCPCR members till new body is formed
description: Consider the representations made to this effect by the APSCPCR Chairperson and members, HC tells the Secretary of WD&CW Department

title: Diamonds and rust
description: With India being the world’s largest exporter of loose cut and polished diamonds, thousands of jewellery exporters in Maharashtra and lakhs of skilled artisans in Gujarat are worried about the impact of the 50% U.S. tariff on gems and 57% on jewels. Business owners tell Vinaya Deshpande Pandit that they are asking the government for short-term policy relief

title: Boxing: Historic night! Jaismine crowned world champ, Nupur takes silver
description: Jaismine Lamboria clinched a historic gold for India in the women's 57kg category at the World Boxing Championships 2025, held in Liverpool, defeating Poland's Julia Szeremeta. Nupur added to India's success with a silver in the +80kg division. Pooja Rani secured a bronze, marking India's best-ever performance with three finalists.

title: 'Unite the Kingdom': Massive anti-immigration protests rock London; cops 'assaulted with kicks, punches'
description: London witnessed a massive "Unite the Kingdom" rally led by far-right activist Tommy Robinson, drawing over 100,000 participants expressing anti-migrant sentiments. The march, framed as a free speech event, featured speakers promoting racist conspiracy theories, sparking clashes with police and a counter-protest.

Despite their strong bond, they face social media trolling, addressing comments on their interracial marriage with humor and resilience. Andrei, a Russian entrepreneur and tennis enthusiast, once surprised Shriya by recreating her 'Arjun' film locations in St. Petersburg. Shriya is currently enjoying the success of 'Mirai,' which has grossed over Rs 26 crores.

description: Fatty liver disease, a growing global health concern, may have a new, inexpensive treatment option. A recent study identified vitamin B3 (niacin) as a potential agent to reduce liver fat accumulation and improve insulin sensitivity by targeting a key molecule, miR-93.

This subtle jab appears to counter Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha's earlier reaction to suggestions of Afghanistan's strength.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Why is FBI director Kash Patel under fire?

The realpolitik of a reel hero
description: For years, Vijay has been and remains the top-paid artiste in Kollywood and possibly among the highest-paid film stars in the country. His fans form legions ready to take up the cudgels for him, quite belligerently at that, at the mere sign of criticism — either of his movies or of the actor himself. It is this hood that he hopes will stand by him as he quits a successful career at its peak to enter politics and help him become a hero in this arena too. But what is his ideology and what are the issues that drive his party? B. Aravind Kumar analyses the political landscape, with inputs from B. Kolappan, S. Ganesan, and N. Sai Charan

description: Bollywood actor Zayed Khan has come out in full support of Team India before their high-voltage Asia Cup 2025 clash against Pakistan. Confident about the Men in Blue’s form, Zayed declared that India will dominate the tournament, calling them a “damn good team.”

title: ‘Illegal’ houses of two rape accused razed in M.P. under security
description: Bhopal Collector Kaushalendra Vikram Singh told The Hindu that the houses were built on illegally encroached government land and that the families of the two men were living there on rent.

description: Punjab BJP president accused the AAP government of not utilising the State Disaster Relief Fund, demanding Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to apologise to the people of Punjab

title: Allen vs Jets: Bills QB injury in spotlight — latest update ahead
description: Josh Allen is set to lead the Buffalo Bills against the New York Jets in a crucial AFC East showdown, despite no official injury update. Allen remains focused after their Week 1 comeback victory. The Bills must address their run defense against Justin Fields and the Jets, who are coming off a narrow loss.

Corey Perry sidelined after knee surgery, out 6-8 weeks for Los Angeles Kings
description: Veteran forward Corey Perry's debut with the Los Angeles Kings is delayed due to a knee injury sustained during training. The 40-year-old, signed in July, will be sidelined for 6-8 weeks, potentially missing October, including the home opener against Colorado. The Kings remain optimistic about Perry's return, valuing his experience and scoring ability for a deep playoff run.

Davis Cup: Epic! India defeat Switzerland for a rare milestone since 1993
description: India have made it to the Davis Cup Qualifiers. Sumit Nagal's win over Henry Bernet sealed the victory against Switzerland. This is India's first away win against a European team since 1993. Nagal's return to the Davis Cup proved crucial. Earlier, N Sriram Balaji and Rithvik Bollipalli lost the doubles match. The Davis Cup Qualifiers are scheduled for January 2026.

Are you experiencing 'tall poppy syndrome'? Subtle workplace signs to notice
description: Tall Poppy Syndrome, prevalent globally but originating in Australia and New Zealand, describes the phenomenon of high achievers being subtly undermined in workplaces. A study reveals this affects women disproportionately, impacting confidence and mental health. This manifests as exclusion, downplaying ambition, and reluctance to showcase creative work, hindering both individual growth and organizational innovation.

China gold licences: Yellow metal’s largest buyer to ease rules; diversify from dollar
description: China is easing gold import/export licensing, aiming to diversify reserves from the US dollar. The People's Bank of China (PBOC) plans to broaden the use of faster “multi-use permits” by increasing authorized ports and extending permit validity. This builds on a 2016 initiative to streamline gold trade.

description: The upcoming India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash ignites political controversy. Shiv Sena (UBT) and Congress leaders criticize the match as immoral and profit-driven, citing past grievances and questioning the government's stance. BJP leaders, however, rally behind the Indian team, framing it as a matter of national pride. Maharashtra leaders exchange barbs, highlighting the deep divisions surrounding the event.

SC dismisses NUJS's sexual harassment complaint; orders VC to mention judgment in resume
description: The Supreme Court dismissed a sexual harassment complaint against the NUJS Vice-Chancellor, citing a delay in filing beyond the POSH Act's limitation period. While the court acknowledged the delayed complaint, it directed that the judgment be included in the Vice-Chancellor's resume. This unusual directive serves as a permanent record of the allegations, despite their dismissal on procedural grounds.

Sanford International round: John Daly makes history; shocking 19 on 12th hole
description: Golf icon John Daly made unwanted history at the Sanford International, carding a shocking 19 on the par-5 12th hole. This score is now the highest ever recorded on a single hole in Champions Tour history. Daly's troubles began with a wayward tee shot, and lead to seven penalty drops.

New study warns fish oil supplements linked to heart disease; raises high risks
description: Recent research from the British Heart Foundation suggests regular fish oil supplements may slightly elevate stroke and atrial fibrillation risk in healthy individuals. Conversely, those with existing heart conditions might experience reduced heart attack risk and improved survival. Experts recommend obtaining omega-3s through diet, emphasizing oily fish, nuts, and seeds.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
description: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO
description: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: ‘That wasn’t even a moment’: Fans slam NFL over Charlie Kirk tribute; sparks outrage
description: The NFL and Green Bay Packers honored Charlie Kirk with a moment of silence before facing the Washington Commanders. Fans called it rushed and poorly executed, slamming the league for inconsistency compared to past public statements. Kirk, 31, was killed Wednesday in Utah. The tribute came as Trump vowed to award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Utah tragedy: Patrick Mahomes silent after Kirk shooting; Randi, Tavia speak out
description: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

title: Apple iPhone 17 series: Check prices in US, Dubai, and more; pre-order started
description: Apple has launched its iPhone 17 lineup, including the iPhone 17, Pro, Pro Max, and a new iPhone Air. The series features performance boosts, enhanced battery life, and upgraded cameras. Global pricing details are now available for various regions, including the US, India, Singapore, and Vietnam. Pre-orders begin September 12, with sales starting September 26.
